intro: Borreria noronhensis, commonly known as the Brazilian milkweed, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in shrubland and forest understory habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Borreria noronhensis is also known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal remedies.
